title: The Shudra Rebellion
description: The Shudra Rebellion presents a bold new history of Indian civilization and culture, revealing the long-overlooked and vital role of shudra nationalism in shaping India’s past and future. Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd raises thought-provoking questions: Does the philosophy of Agriculturism account for the divergent paths of China and India? Does the Jewish community’s ability to transcend their caste-like system explain their ascent to power? This book centralizes shudra nationalism and heritage to redefine India’s identity and future.
author: Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd
